00006 ##################################################
00007 #
00008 #  Convert a student answer to a formula, with error trapping.
00009 #  If the result is undef, there was an error (message is in Context()->{error} object)
00010 #
00011 
00012 package Parser;
00013 
00014 sub Formula {
00015   my $v = eval {Value->Package("Formula")->new(@_)};
00016   reportEvalError($@) unless defined($v) || Value->context->{error}{flag};
00017   return $v;
00018 }
00019 
00020 #
00021 #  Evaluate a formula, with error trapping.
00022 #  If the result is undef, there was an error (message is in Context()->{error} object)
00023 #  If the result was a real, make it a fuzzy one.
00024 #
00025 sub Evaluate {
00026   my $f = shift;
00027   return unless defined($f);
00028   my $v = eval {$f->eval(@_)};
00029   if (defined($v)) {$v = Value::makeValue($v)}
00030     else {reportEvalError($@) unless $f->{context}{error}{flag}}
00031   return $v;
00032 }
00033 
00034 #
00035 #  Call a subtroutine with error trapping.
00036 #  (We need to be able to do this from custom
00037 #   answer checkers and other MathObject code.
00038 #   PG_restricted_eval is not sufficient for this
00039 #   since that uses a string and so can't access
00040 #   local variables from the calling routine.)
00041 #
00042 sub Eval {
00043   my $f = shift;
00044   return unless defined($f);
00045   eval {&$f(@_)};
00046 }
00047 
00048 #
00049 #  Remove backtrace and line number, since these
00050 #  will be reported in the student message area.
00051 #
00052 sub reportEvalError {
00053   my $error = shift; my $fullerror = $error;
00054   $error =~ s/ at \S+\.\S+ line \d+(\n|.)*//;
00055   $error =~ s/ at line \d+ of (\n|.)*//;
00056   Value->context->setError($error);
00057   if (Value->context->{debug}) {
00058     $fullerror =~ s/\n/<BR>/g;
00059     warn $fullerror;
00060   }
00061 }
00062 
00063 package main;

00065 #####################################################
00066 #
00067 # Use PG random number generator rather than perl
00068 #
00069 sub Value::Formula::PGseedRandom {
00070   my $self = shift;
00071   return if $self->{PGrandom};
00072   $self->{PGrandom} = new PGrandom($self->{context}->flag('random_seed'));
00073 }
00074 sub Value::Formula::PGgetRandom {shift->{PGrandom}->random(@_)}

00077 #
00078 #  Initialize contexts with WW default data
00079 #
00080 
00081 my @wwEvalFields = qw(
00082   functAbsTolDefault
00083   functNumOfPoints
00084   functRelPercentTolDefault
00085   functZeroLevelDefault
00086   functZeroLevelTolDefault
00087   functMaxConstantOfIntegration
00088   numAbsTolDefault
00089   numFormatDefault
00090   numRelPercentTolDefault
00091   numZeroLevelDefault
00092   numZeroLevelTolDefault
00093   useBaseTenLog
00094 );
00095 
00096 sub Parser::Context::copy {
00097   my $self = shift;
00098   my $context = Value::Context::copy($self,@_);
00099   return $context unless $Parser::installed;  # only do WW initialization after parser is fully loaded
00100   return $context if $context->{WW} && scalar(keys %{$context->{WW}}) > 0;
00101   my $envir = eval('\\%main::envir');
00102   return $context unless $envir && scalar(keys(%{$envir})) > 0;
00103   my $ww = $context->{WW} = {}; push @{$context->{data}{values}}, 'WW';
00104   return $context if $Value::_no_WeBWorK_; # hack for command-line debugging
00105   foreach my $x (@wwEvalFields) {$context->{WW}{$x} = $envir->{$x}}
00106   $context->flags->set(
00107      tolerance      => $ww->{numRelPercentTolDefault} / 100,
00108      zeroLevel      => $ww->{numZeroLevelDefault},
00109      zeroLevelTol   => $ww->{numZeroLevelTolDefault},
00110      num_points     => $ww->{functNumOfPoints} + 2,
00111      max_adapt      => $ww->{functMaxConstantOfIntegration},
00112      useBaseTenLog  => $ww->{useBaseTenLog},
00113   );
00114   $context->{format}{number} = $ww->{numFormatDefault} if $ww->{numFormatDefault} ne '';
00115   $context;
00116 }
